intro: Guarea glauca, commonly known as the white ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dense, heavy wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces woody fruits that contain a single, large seed. Guarea glauca plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
